Midas Documentation » SECTION 5: Run Control » Run Control Programs » mhttpd: the MIDAS Web-based Run Control utility » Custom pages

JavaScript built-in library mhttpd.js

Many of the supported features of MIDAS Custom web pages are available under HTML, but others rely on the inclusion of the mhttpd JavaScript (JS) library . This JS library relies on certain new commands which are built into mhttpd, and is therefore hardcoded into mhttpd.c .

The JS library can be viewed by entering in your browser location box: 

http://<mhttpd host>/mhttpd.js

i.e. if running mhttpd on host "midaspc" on port 8081, you would enter : 

http://midaspc:8081/mhttpd.js

to view the JS library. Alternatively, a recent version is shown here:

  • Javascript Built-In library Javascript Built-in Library code : mhttpd.js


List of functions in JS library

Use of the following functions in custom webpages require the JS library to be included:

  • ODBGet
  • ODBSet
  • ODBEdit
  • ODBKey
  • ODBGetMsg
  • getMouseXY
  • ODBRpc_rev0

Include the JS library mhttpd.js in a custom page

In order to use any of the JavaScript built-in functions, you must include the library in your custom page by putting the following statement inside the <head>...</head> tags of an HTML file:

<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 TRANSITIONAL//EN">
<html><head>
<title> ODBEdit test</title>
<script type="text/javascript" src="../mhttpd.js"></script>
...
</head>
...
</html>
